wikipedia_page.main: Sir John George Tollemache Sinclair, 3rd Baronet (8 November 1825 – 30 September 1912) was a Scottish landowner and Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1869 to 1885.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: ***Sir John Sinclair, 3rd Baronet (1825–1912), eldest son of the 2nd Baronet. Scottish Liberal MP for Caithness 1869–1885
*Sir John Sinclair, 3rd Baronet (1825–1912), Scottish politician and landowner

link_mentions.page: Sir John George Tollemache Sinclair, 3rd Baronet

response: Williams married, firstly, in 1862 Fanny Florence Caulfeild, daughter of St George Francis Caulfeild of Donarvon Castle, Roscommon, who died in 1876. He married, secondly, Nina Mary Adelaide Sinclair, daughter of Sir John Sinclair, 3rd Baronet. She survived him and died in 1924, her heir being Hwfa Williams (died 1926), her husband's brother. Temple House was demolished c.1922, or c.1930.
